activities:
Processing of personal information of employees, potential employees, health care professionals, patients, clinical research study subjects and vendors/service providers.  This information is transferred to Amgen Inc. in the United States and is processed for purposes of its business operations.  This includes processing related to: 
•	The support and fulfillment of Amgen Inc.'s obligations as an employer to its employees 
•	Research and development of its products 
•	Administration and management of its relationships with customers 
•	Market research, marketing and sales of its products 
•	Global Pharmacovigilance and product complaint management
•	Health and safety monitoring and management
•	Compliance with regulatory obligations, as well as finance and tax activities 
•	Administration and management of its relationships with vendors, suppliers and contractors, and 
•	Other legal and business activities
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Croatia, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom
personaldata: On-Line, Off-Line and Manually: Customer, Patients, Clinical Research Study Subjects, Human Resources, Vendors/Service Providers
recoursemech: Judicial Arbitration and Mediation Services, Inc. (JAMS) for non-human resources data.  EU Data Protection Authorities (DPAs) and Swiss Federal Data Protection and Information Commissioner (FDPIC) for human resources data only.
